titleStmt.title: SII 12.204: original edition by V. Venkatasubba Ayyar
No. 204. (A.R. No. 196 of 1930). KUNNATTŪR, SRIPERUMBUDUR TALUK, CHINGLEPUT DISTRICT. ON THE WEST WALL OF THE CENTRAL SHRINE IN THE TIRUNĀGĒŚVARA TEMPLE.

summary.p: In this record dated in the 17th year, it is stated that the assembly in charge of the central shrine in the temple of Tirunāgīśvaramuḍaiya-Nāyaṉār at Kuṉṟattūr in Puliyūr-kōṭṭam alias Kulōttuṅgaśōḻa-vaḷanāḍu, a subdivision of Jayaṅgoṇḍaśōḻa-maṇḍalam, received 3 paḻaṅkāśu from Piṟaiyaṇivāṇudalār, the daughter of Poṉṉāḻvār, a servant attached to the temple and agreed to burn a twilight lamp before the image of Dakshiṇāmūrti set up by her in the temple. It may be pointed out here that in this inscription no distinction is made between the territorial divisions ‘kōṭṭam’ and ‘vaḷanāḍu’.

revisionDesc.change: Further conversion of digital encoding to DHARMA encoding scheme according to EGD (Encoding Guide for Diplomatic Editions)

div.p:
svasti śrī . cakalabhu vaṉaccakkaravattikaḷ śrīkopperuñciṅkatevarkku yāṇṭu 10 7vatu jayaṅ koṇṭacoḻamaṇṭalattup puliyūrkkoṭṭamāṉa kulottuṅkacoḻavaḷanāṭṭuk kuṉṟattū
r Uṭai yār tirunāgiśu varamuṭai yanāyaṉār koyil kāṇiyuṭai tiruvuṇṇāḻikaic capai yom . Ikkoyil tevaraṭiyāḷ poṉṉāḻvār makaḷ piṟai ya[ṇivāēngraved below the line.]ṇutalār kuṭ ṭattil Eḻuntaruḷuvitta dekṣi ṇāmurttide vark
ku cantirātittavarai Oru cantiviḷakku Erikka kaṭavomāka Ivar pakkal kai kkoṇṭa paḻaṅkācu 3 Ippaḻaṅkācu muṉṟum kaikkoṇṭu cantirātittavarai Erikka kaṭavomākac cammatittom Ikko
yil tiruvuṇṇāḻikai c capaiyom . Itu paṉmāheśuvara rakṣaiḥ—
Digital edition of SII 12.204 by converted to DHARMA conventions by Emmanuel Francis.
